results.description: Dr. Jonas Almeida leads a multidisciplinary research program that combines systems biology, computational statistics, and software engineering for biomedical applications.
results.title: Jonas S. Almeida, Ph.D. - biography - National Cancer Institute

results.description: Jonas S. Almeida, Ph.D., has been appointed Chief Data Scientist in DCEG. He is internationally recognized for his work on integrative biomedical applications that combine systems biology, computational statistics, and software engineering.
results.title: Jonas Almeida Named Chief Data Scientist of DCEG - National Cancer Institute

results.description: What does data science bring to the table of population health and cancer prevention?
results.title: Event: What does data science bring to the table of population health and cancer prevention? - Dr. J - National Cancer Institute

results.description: Michele Doody, M.S., a staff scientist in the Radiation Epidemiology Branch (REB), retired at the end of December 2018 after more than 30 years of federal service. Her research focused on the role of low-dose radiation in carcinogenesis from both diagnostic and occupational exposures.
results.title: Michele Doody retires from NCI after more than 30 years - National Cancer Institute

results.description: New consensus-based recommendations for the clinical management of patients with Myotonic Dystrophy type 1 (DM1) were based in part on research by investigators in the Clinical Genetics Branch.
results.title: Myotonic Dystrophy Type 1 Clinical Care Recommendations Influenced by DCEG Research - National Cancer Institute

results.description: COVID Mortality Tracker allows DCEG investigators to monitor weekly U.S. trends in overall and cause-specific mortality since the onset of the COVID-19 pandemic. The tools uses data visualization techniques to reveal patterns and generate potential research questions.
results.title: COVID-19 Mortality Tracker - National Cancer Institute

results.description: The Trans-Divisional Research Program (TDRP) conducts and facilitates trans-divisional research in cancer epidemiology, genetics and prevention across DCEG.
results.title: Trans-Divisional Research Program - National Cancer Institute

results.description: Meet the fellows currently in the Data Science & Engineering Research Group and learn about the types of research they are working on.
results.title: Current Fellows in the Data Science & Engineering Research Group - National Cancer Institute

results.description: The DCEG Data Science & Engineering Research Group seeks to advance research and infrastructure for data-intensive precision prevention studies.
results.title: Data Science & Engineering Research Group - National Cancer Institute
